page.title: 13Staining Mill Staff
page.content: There has been a mill in the village of Staining for approximately 300 years. The present mill is about 160 years old. It used to mill local wheat and barley but was last used in the 1920s. The building was then used as a factory producing ready mixed products for the catering industry. In 1980 it was converted to a house. At present the cap has been renewed and is able to move round. By the end of the year it is hoped that sails will be restored to the building. The wind shaft is already in place. In 1880 a pedlar was murdered at the mill. With his blood he wrote the word "Jenny" on the wall outside. This was retained for many years since the miller's wife thought that ill luck would befall them if it were removed. Two people are known to have fallen to their deaths from the top.
